label: 和学
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 3:  Medieval Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1990
説明文: Japanese scholarship, which consisted of two general areas of study: the corpus of waka-centered, classical court literature and the court ceremonial and practice-the accumulated rituals, customs, and minutiae of court life. It reached its peak of development in the late fourteenth and fifteenth centuries.　[和歌]
